Basic Table

For basic styling—light padding and only horizontal dividers—add the base class .table to any <table>. It may seem super redundant, but given the widespread use of tables for other plugins like calendars and date pickers, we've opted to isolate table styles.

Example:

# First Name Last Name Username
1 Mark Otto @mdo
2 Jacob Thornton @fat
3 Larry the Bird @twitter

Source code:


    
        

            #
            First Name
            Last Name
            Username
        

    
    
        

            1
            Mark
            Otto
            @mdo
        

        

            2
            Jacob
            Thornton
            @fat
        

        

            3
            Larry
            the Bird
            @twitter

Default Table

The official table design for ca.gov. Use .table-default

Example:

# First Name Last Name Username
1 Mark Otto @mdo
2 Jacob Thornton @fat
3 Larry the Bird @twitter

Source code:


    
        

            #
            First Name
            Last Name
            Username
        

    
    
        

            1
            Mark
            Otto
            @mdo
        

        

            2
            Jacob
            Thornton
            @fat
        

        

            3
            Larry
            the Bird
            @twitter

Zebra Striped Table

Use .table-striped to add zebra-striping to any table row within the <tbody>.

Example:

# First Name Last Name Username
1 Mark Otto @mdo
2 Jacob Thornton @fat
3 Larry the Bird @twitter

Source code:


    
        

            #
            First Name
            Last Name
            Username
        

    
    
        

            1
            Mark
            Otto
            @mdo
        

        

            2
            Jacob
            Thornton
            @fat
        

        

            3
            Larry
            the Bird
            @twitter

Bordered Table

Add .table-bordered for borders on all sides of the table and cells.

Example:

# First Name Last Name Username
1 Mark Otto @mdo
2 Jacob Thornton @fat
3 Larry the Bird @twitter

Source code:


    
        

            #
            First Name
            Last Name
            Username
        

    
    
        

            1
            Mark
            Otto
            @mdo
        

        

            2
            Jacob
            Thornton
            @fat
        

        

            3
            Larry
            the Bird
            @twitter

Responsive Table

Create responsive tables by wrapping any .table in .table-responsive div to make them scroll horizontally on small devices (under 768px). When viewing on anything larger than 768px wide, you will not see any difference in these tables.

Example:

# Table heading Table heading Table heading Table heading Table heading Table heading
1 Table cell Table cell Table cell Table cell Table cell Table cell
2 Table cell Table cell Table cell Table cell Table cell Table cell
3 Table cell Table cell Table cell Table cell Table cell Table cell

Source code:


      

        
          

            #
            Table heading
            Table heading
            Table heading
            Table heading
            Table heading
            Table heading
          

        
        
          

            1
            Table cell
            Table cell
            Table cell
            Table cell
            Table cell
            Table cell
          

          

            2
            Table cell
            Table cell
            Table cell
            Table cell
            Table cell
            Table cell
          

          

            3
            Table cell
            Table cell
            Table cell
            Table cell
            Table cell
            Table cell
